_list._blog_post_body:
The generator is a new d-portal feature that allows users to select subsets of International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI) information from the d-portal website and embed them into their own websites and blogs.

What is d-portal?

d-portal is a platform that makes all IATI data available and accessible for anyone to explore. We set it up with the aim of allowing people in developing countries to view IATI information from their own country’s perspective. Nearly 300 organisations currently publish data on their activities to the IATI registry - d-portal transforms this machine-readable data into information for humans to understand. It shows you all published IATI data from the point of view of a recipient country or a publisher, and gives you the chance to drill down to individual project detail. Users can see what data exists, who has published and who hasn’t yet, and where there are data quality issues.

What does the d-portal generator do?

There is a huge amount of interesting information within IATI (and therefore, d-portal) and significant value in being able to share bite-size pieces of it freely on other websites and blogs. The d-portal generator allows users to select specific information from d-portal and embed it directly into their own website code.

How do you use the generator?

There are lots of combinations and possibilities of what to choose when selecting from the vast amount of data in d-portal, so we tried to make the process as simple as possible…



1 – Choose a combination of Publisher(s) and Recipient(s) information you want to see

2 – Select how you want to display it (a map, table, list, pie chart, etc)

3 – Select a colour scheme and re-size the width if required

Once you’ve completed steps 1 & 2 (3 is optional), you’ll see some code appear automatically in the white box, and an example of your selected content below that box (as below). You then just need to copy the code and paste it into the code of your website or blog post, to embed the content you’ve generated.



Here’s the live example of the content which we've chosen, and embedded into this page:

Once you’ve embedded any content it will update automatically (overnight) as publishers’ data is updated in the IATI registry. When users click on the content they will be directed to the relevant page on d-portal so they can investigate further.

We have used the tool to embed a simple table about our IATI data here. We have also created a page showing some more examples of what you can do with d-portal generator content here.

More about…

IATI data includes data from donor governments and multilaterals, NGOs, foundations and private sector companies. It is forward-looking (it contains 2015 data from many publishers), comparable and increasingly comprehensive.

Both the d-portal and the d-portal generator are currently in beta. We’d love to hear your feedback, so please let us know if you use either d-portal or the generator, and tell us about your experience; please send comments, queries and feedback to support@iatistandard.org, or raise issues on the d-portal GitHub.

If you are interested in finding out more or part-funding d-portal, please contact support@iatistandard.org

Links

Create IATI content with the d-portal Generator

_blog_post_json.author: Matt Bartlett
_blog_post_json.title: Bringing IATI data to life: d-portal generator

_list._body:
Matt Bartlett ~ Project Manager
Posted in Overview
2014-11-28
Bringing IATI data to life: d-portal generator

The generator is a new d-portal feature that allows users to select subsets of International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI) information from the d-portal website and embed them into their own websites and blogs.

What is d-portal?

d-portal is a platform that makes all IATI data available and accessible for anyone to explore. We set it up with the aim of allowing people in developing countries to view IATI information from their own country’s perspective. Nearly 300 organisations currently publish data on their activities to the IATI registry - d-portal transforms this machine-readable data into information for humans to understand. It shows you all published IATI data from the point of view of a recipient country or a publisher, and gives you the chance to drill down to individual project detail. Users can see what data exists, who has published and who hasn’t yet, and where there are data quality issues.

What does the d-portal generator do?

There is a huge amount of interesting information within IATI (and therefore, d-portal) and significant value in being able to share bite-size pieces of it freely on other websites and blogs. The d-portal generator allows users to select specific information from d-portal and embed it directly into their own website code.

How do you use the generator?

There are lots of combinations and possibilities of what to choose when selecting from the vast amount of data in d-portal, so we tried to make the process as simple as possible…



1 – Choose a combination of Publisher(s) and Recipient(s) information you want to see

2 – Select how you want to display it (a map, table, list, pie chart, etc)

3 – Select a colour scheme and re-size the width if required

Once you’ve completed steps 1 & 2 (3 is optional), you’ll see some code appear automatically in the white box, and an example of your selected content below that box (as below). You then just need to copy the code and paste it into the code of your website or blog post, to embed the content you’ve generated.



Here’s the live example of the content which we've chosen, and embedded into this page:

Once you’ve embedded any content it will update automatically (overnight) as publishers’ data is updated in the IATI registry. When users click on the content they will be directed to the relevant page on d-portal so they can investigate further.

We have used the tool to embed a simple table about our IATI data here. We have also created a page showing some more examples of what you can do with d-portal generator content here.

More about…

IATI data includes data from donor governments and multilaterals, NGOs, foundations and private sector companies. It is forward-looking (it contains 2015 data from many publishers), comparable and increasingly comprehensive.

Both the d-portal and the d-portal generator are currently in beta. We’d love to hear your feedback, so please let us know if you use either d-portal or the generator, and tell us about your experience; please send comments, queries and feedback to support@iatistandard.org, or raise issues on the d-portal GitHub.

If you are interested in finding out more or part-funding d-portal, please contact support@iatistandard.org

Links

Create IATI content with the d-portal Generator
_list.about_paragraph10_text: IATI is funding current development. If you are interested in funding part of the ongoing development of d-portal, or specific pieces of future development, please contact support@iatistandard.org
_list.about_paragraph11_text: The open source concept relies on sharing resources in the hopes that others will join in and build a better platform together. This includes finding and reporting bugs, contributing new features that you'd like the platform to have or even creating new themes so that others may use it.
_list.about_paragraph12_text: Other sites based on d-portal will be listed below, get in touch to add yours!
_list.about_paragraph14_text: 1. Where do resources come from?2. Where do they go (by sector and location)?
_list.about_paragraph15_text: Recent, current and future data is presented and compared across data sources.
_list.about_paragraph1_text: d-portal.org helps you explore IATI data by providing a search function and information by country or by publisher on development activities and budgets published to the platform.
_list.about_paragraph2_text: It is aimed at providing line ministries, parliamentarians and civil society in developing countries with information that can assist with the planning and monitoring of development activities.
_list.about_paragraph3_text: d-portal contains current data published to the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI) as well as the most recent year's data available in the OECD DAC Creditor Reporting System.
_list.about_paragraph4_text: The current platform poses two questions:
_list.about_paragraph5_text: In order to answer these questions from a country perspective it is insufficient merely to display available data: it is equally important to show the gaps in the information. Coping with poor quality or missing data is an essential part of the information interface.
_list.about_paragraph6_text: is an open source platform. This means you can use all aspects of the platform to build your own portal using the free source code.
_list.about_paragraph7_text: While it currently provides a generic deployment for any country it has been developed with the specific intention of being customised in-country to meet local needs. For further information on how you could create a customised version for a specific country, see How to Install.
_list.about_paragraph9_text: The initial development of d-portal.org which ran from Dec 2013 to the Global Partnership meeting in Mexico in April 2014 was funded by IATI and Development Initiatives (DI).
_list.alert1_text: d-portal.org is still in beta. Thank you for your patience! Please provide any feedback
_list.beige0: {beige_alert_text} {beige_alert_here_text}.
_list.country_dropmenu_text: Type to search for a Recipient Country
_list.dash_paragraph1_text: Dash is an overview of the data populating d-portal.org with a focus primarily on publisher statistics and the quality of the data reported by them.
_list.dash_paragraph2_text: By showing you when and where invalid data is reported, Dash will be able to explain the gaps that are reflected on the main site.
_list.dash_paragraph3_text: Dash is not country specific so you will be able to view all of the publisher statistics available across all countries included in the portal. This is to accommodate the fact that there are multiple publishers that report activities in multiple recipient countries.
_list.dash_paragraph4_text: Dash is currently accessible at http://d-portal.org/ctrack.html?#view=dash. Dash is still being developed.
_list.discover_paragraph1_text: Discover is a new feature that is currently under second stage of development. Backed by dstore and Q, it provides a simple interface for users to filter through the vast IATI database.
_list.discover_paragraph2_text: We are currently seeking feedback about the intuitiveness and usability of Discover. Do have a go and send us your feedback by adding a new issue through the Github forum or, if you prefer, get in touch through support@iatistandard.org. We'd love to hear what you think!
_list.dstore_paragraph_text: dstore subsidises the IATI Registry with an optimized nodejs + SQLite version for use in real time queries.
_list.explore_paragraph1_text: Pick a country or publisher below to explore their data.
_list.explore_paragraph2_text: Only countries and publishers with data published to IATI are available for exploration.
_list.faq_paragraph1_text: d-portal is an expansive site that contains not only the country and publisher based portals but also tools like SAVi, Generator, Dash and the recently developed Discover - a simple search interface backed by dstore and Q. With this comes a growing database of questions about the architecture and functionality of the different parts of the site.
_list.faq_paragraph2_text: These are broken down into 3 different types of questions - General, Technical and questions about the Generator.
_list.feedback_paragraph1_text: Hello all and thank you for taking part as beta testers for d-portal.org. We welcome any and all feedback, suggestions and concerns you may have about the website so please feel free to post them as comments below. Overall, we want to focus on legibility and user experience, especially in terms of understanding the data that is being presented.
_list.feedback_paragraph2_text: Thank you very much for taking the time to do this! We hope to create something useful and easily deployable, an interesting talking point but most importantly, promote use by those who need the information, and better data quality from reporting organisations.
_list.footer1_text: A 2017 project by the d-portal team
_list.footer8_text: It provides a search function and information by country or by publisher on development activities and budgets published to IATI.
_list.footer9_text: We are currently in BETA. While d-portal is publicly available, it is not considered finished. You may experience bugs and missing features, but that is why we need your feedback and support.
_list.gen_paragraph1_text: There is a huge amount of interesting information within IATI and significant value in being able to share bite-size pieces of it freely on other websites and blogs. The d-portal generator allows users to select specific information from d-portal and embed it directly into their own website code.
_list.gen_paragraph2_text: Once you’ve embedded any content it will update automatically (overnight) as publishers’ data is updated in the IATI registry. When users click on the content they will be directed to the relevant page on d-portal so they can investigate further.
_list.gen_paragraph3_text: The generator is currently accessible at http://www.d-portal.org/ctrack.html?#view=generator.
_list.github_info2_text: d-portal.org is open source. It is currently being developed and designed so things are constantly changing. Do send us your suggestions, code contributions, bug reports, fixes and issues or contact support@iatistandard.org
_list.github_info3_text: If you would like to keep up to date with news on d-portal please subscribe to the Google group.
_list.head:
<title>{title}</title>
<style>
{css}
</style>
_list.index_paragraph1_text: helps you explore IATI data by providing a search function and information by country or by publisher on development activities and budgets published to the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI). It is aimed at providing line ministries, parliamentarians and civil society in developing countries with information that can assist with the planning and monitoring of development activities.
_list.index_paragraph2_text: d-portal contains current data published through the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI) as well as the most recent year's data available in the OECD DAC Creditor Reporting System.
_list.index_paragraph3_text: Data in the dropdown menu is built from the database which updates everyday at GMT +0 with new data fetched from the IATI Registry.
_list.index_paragraph4_text: We list countries that are reported by publishers using ISO3166 Alpha-2. For attribution and links to data sources, go here.
_list.index_paragraph5_text: The list of publishers with their IATI publisher ID comes straight from the IATI Registry database.
_list.index_paragraph6_text: The dropdown list of publishers comes from published XML activities reported by these publishers.
_list.install_paragraph1_text: At the heart of the d-portal project is the aim that anyone anywhere could take the open source code behind d-portal, deploy it for themselves and create a customised d-portal for any country that interests them.  This could include adding any other data from Aid Information Management Systems, national budgets and a range of comparable socio-economic indicators.
_list.install_paragraph2_text: There are already examples of customised country-specific d-portals like
_list.install_paragraph3_text: d-portal is made up of the dstore backend and ctrack interface. To install d-portal, you need to set up a server.
_list.install_paragraph4_text: Start reading instructions to install a d-portal server
_list.install_paragraph5_text: By using iframes, the d-portal Generator allows you to embed sections of d-portal in any html-enabled publishing platform; ie. Wordpress blog post, Tumblr post, a website etc.
_list.install_paragraph6_text: Visit http://d-portal.org/ctrack.html#view=generator to generate your chosen d-portal content.
_list.install_title2_text: How to generate and re-use d-portal content

{footer6_text} {footer7_text}

{footer8_text}

_list.main_head: {status} {about_link_text} FAQ Generator Dash {news_link_text} Github {home_link_text} {tongue_select}
_list.news_link2_text: How to create a country d-portal
_list.news_paragraph1_text: This page will contain any updates to information and current features on d-portal over the course of development.
_list.news_paragraph2_text: If you would like to keep up-to-date with news on d-portal through a mailing list, we recommend joining the Google group. This option allows the delivery of d-portal announcements directly into your email inbox.
_list.news_paragraph3_text: Updates are occasional and usually relate to new features or information available on d-portal.
_list.publisher_dropmenu_text: Type to search for a Publisher
_list.publisher_paragraph1_text: Pick a publisher below to explore their data.
_list.q_example1_info1_text: This query displays activities limiting the amount to 10
_list.q_example1_text: Returns XML which is automatically formatted into HTML (SAVi). Source remains pure XML
_list.q_example2_info1_text: This query displays all activities within Bangladesh (country code is BD)
_list.q_example2_info2_text: that have sectors reported in the data
_list.q_example2_info3_text: Ultimately, this query allows you to look at all the activities that have graphs in them.
_list.q_example3_info2_text: about activites for each reporting organisation
_list.q_example3_text: Returns JSON (JSON is default) data about activites (activites are default) where 100 rows from the database is the default limit
_list.q_example4_info1_text: This query allows you to download the CSV
_list.q_example4_text: Returns CSV file (named q.csv by default)
_list.q_example_append1_text: Append queries with your preferred format
_list.q_example_savi_text: Returns XML which is automatically formatted into HTML (SAVi). Source remains pure XML
_list.q_paragraph_text: Q allows you to query information you need via simple but complex filters.
_list.savi_paragraph1_text: SAVi is a simple activity viewer for IATI XML that you can view in real time, online, in your favourite browser.
_list.savi_paragraph2_text: SAVi uses CSS and javascript to display otherwise complex-looking XML in a format that is easier to read and digest.
_list.small_footer:
{footer1_text}
{footer2_text}
{footer3_text}
_list.sources_title_text: Attribution and link to data sources
_list.title: {_blog_post_json.title}
_list.tongue_select:
<form action="">
<select id="tongue_select" name="tongue">
	{tongue_select_options:tongue_select_option}
</select>
</form>

<script>
	$(function(){
		$('#tongue_select').children().each(function(i,it){
			if("{tongue}"==$(it).val())
			{
				$(it).attr("selected",1)
			}
		});
		$('#tongue_select').bind('change', function ()
		{
			var t="{_root}"+$(this).val()+"/";if(t=="{_root}eng/"){t="{_root}";}
			var url = t+"{_output_filename}";
			window.location = url; // redirect
			return false;
		});
	});
</script>

_list._blog_post_body:
Following an initial period of development in the first quarter of 2014, and the launch at the Global Partnership meeting in April, d-portal is now entering a period of consolidation and consultation. During this 3-4 month period we are aiming to do the following...

  • Stabilise the code base
  • Enable easy adoption of the code for anyone to create and customise individual country d-portals
  • Allow the addition of other datasets as simply as possible
  • Develop full guidance for those adopting the code
  • Write up comprehensive documentation and methodology
  • Consult with potential users around the longer term direction for d-portal
  • Consider means of funding and sustaining support and updates for d-portal

This page will contain any updates to information, and announcements on d-portal over the coming months. If you would like to keep up to date with news on d-portal please subscribe to the Google group.

Get in touch...

If you have any queries about d-portal, any comments or suggestions please do contact us at support@iatistandard.org

Links

Interested in funding d-portal? How to create a country d-portal

_list._body:
Matt Bartlett ~ Project Manager
Posted in Overview
2014-05-28
Current plans

Following an initial period of development in the first quarter of 2014, and the launch at the Global Partnership meeting in April, d-portal is now entering a period of consolidation and consultation. During this 3-4 month period we are aiming to do the following...

  • Stabilise the code base
  • Enable easy adoption of the code for anyone to create and customise individual country d-portals
  • Allow the addition of other datasets as simply as possible
  • Develop full guidance for those adopting the code
  • Write up comprehensive documentation and methodology
  • Consult with potential users around the longer term direction for d-portal
  • Consider means of funding and sustaining support and updates for d-portal

This page will contain any updates to information, and announcements on d-portal over the coming months. If you would like to keep up to date with news on d-portal please subscribe to the Google group.

Get in touch...

If you have any queries about d-portal, any comments or suggestions please do contact us at support@iatistandard.org

Links

Interested in funding d-portal? How to create a country d-portal

_list.index_paragraph1_text: helps you explore IATI data by providing a search function and information by country or by publisher on development activities and budgets published to the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI). It is aimed at providing line ministries, parliamentarians and civil society in developing countries with information that can assist with the planning and monitoring of development activities.
_list.index_paragraph2_text: d-portal contains current data published through the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI) as well as the most recent year's data available in the OECD DAC Creditor Reporting System.
_list.index_paragraph3_text: Data in the dropdown menu is built from the database which updates everyday at GMT +0 with new data fetched from the IATI Registry.
_list.index_paragraph4_text: We list countries that are reported by publishers using ISO3166 Alpha-2. For attribution and links to data sources, go here.
_list.index_paragraph5_text: The list of publishers with their IATI publisher ID comes straight from the IATI Registry database.
_list.index_paragraph6_text: The dropdown list of publishers comes from published XML activities reported by these publishers.
_list.install_paragraph1_text: At the heart of the d-portal project is the aim that anyone anywhere could take the open source code behind d-portal, deploy it for themselves and create a customised d-portal for any country that interests them.  This could include adding any other data from Aid Information Management Systems, national budgets and a range of comparable socio-economic indicators.
_list.install_paragraph2_text: There are already examples of customised country-specific d-portals like
_list.install_paragraph3_text: d-portal is made up of the dstore backend and ctrack interface. To install d-portal, you need to set up a server.
_list.install_paragraph4_text: Start reading instructions to install a d-portal server
_list.install_paragraph5_text: By using iframes, the d-portal Generator allows you to embed sections of d-portal in any html-enabled publishing platform; ie. Wordpress blog post, Tumblr post, a website etc.
_list.install_paragraph6_text: Visit http://d-portal.org/ctrack.html#view=generator to generate your chosen d-portal content.
_list.install_title2_text: How to generate and re-use d-portal content

<script>
	$(function(){
		$('#tongue_select').children().each(function(i,it){
			if("{tongue}"==$(it).val())
			{
				$(it).attr("selected",1)
			}
		});
		$('#tongue_select').bind('change', function ()
		{
			var t="{_root}"+$(this).val()+"/";if(t=="{_root}eng/"){t="{_root}";}
			var url = t+"{_output_filename}";
			window.location = url; // redirect
			return false;
		});
	});
</script>

_list._blog_post_body:
...or 'Why we chose to use ECMAScript'.

We've been working on a project to build a re-usable piece of code that can be easily hosted by anyone, anywhere and that will tell an interesting story using IATI data, under the working title; D-Portal https://github.com/devinit/D-Portal

We were asked to build a HTML5 serverless design that would be easy to deploy and configure, so it was inevitable that ECMAScript (i.e. Javascript) would have to be used browser side.

Languages are always a contentious issue among programmers and picking a language to use for a project is not only a matter of compromise but something that has to be decided on rather quickly or it becomes very hard to make any progress.

We soon discovered that we would also need to have a server side component, something that processes raw data and makes it available to the client in a more digestible format. This could be written in any language but we chose to use a node server. Primarily this allows the same code to be shared between server and client and reduces code dependencies.

On top of this we use a zero configuration database (SQLite) so there is no need to install, configure and maintain a complicated database server.

Even if you do not consider yourself an ECMAScript programmer the ubiquity of the language online means that you have almost certainly worked with it, maybe you even consider it your second language. It is quite simply the language of the web and although Node is still rather new, what it represents is an inevitable, unstoppable spread of the language onto the server.

  • ECMAScript is the technical name of JSscript or JavaScript.
  • KISS is the design principle behind all of these decisions.
  • Node is a webserver based on googles V8 ECMAScript engine.



Originally posted on http://iati.github.io/

_list._body:
Kriss ~ Lead Developer
Posted in Technical
2014-05-08
Development Portal Architecture

...or 'Why we chose to use ECMAScript'.

We've been working on a project to build a re-usable piece of code that can be easily hosted by anyone, anywhere and that will tell an interesting story using IATI data, under the working title; D-Portal https://github.com/devinit/D-Portal

We were asked to build a HTML5 serverless design that would be easy to deploy and configure, so it was inevitable that ECMAScript (i.e. Javascript) would have to be used browser side.

Languages are always a contentious issue among programmers and picking a language to use for a project is not only a matter of compromise but something that has to be decided on rather quickly or it becomes very hard to make any progress.

We soon discovered that we would also need to have a server side component, something that processes raw data and makes it available to the client in a more digestible format. This could be written in any language but we chose to use a node server. Primarily this allows the same code to be shared between server and client and reduces code dependencies.

On top of this we use a zero configuration database (SQLite) so there is no need to install, configure and maintain a complicated database server.

Even if you do not consider yourself an ECMAScript programmer the ubiquity of the language online means that you have almost certainly worked with it, maybe you even consider it your second language. It is quite simply the language of the web and although Node is still rather new, what it represents is an inevitable, unstoppable spread of the language onto the server.

  • ECMAScript is the technical name of JSscript or JavaScript.
  • KISS is the design principle behind all of these decisions.
  • Node is a webserver based on googles V8 ECMAScript engine.



Originally posted on http://iati.github.io/
_list.about_paragraph10_text: IATI is funding current development. If you are interested in funding part of the ongoing development of d-portal, or specific pieces of future development, please contact support@iatistandard.org
_list.about_paragraph11_text: The open source concept relies on sharing resources in the hopes that others will join in and build a better platform together. This includes finding and reporting bugs, contributing new features that you'd like the platform to have or even creating new themes so that others may use it.
_list.about_paragraph12_text: Other sites based on d-portal will be listed below, get in touch to add yours!
_list.about_paragraph14_text: 1. Where do resources come from?2. Where do they go (by sector and location)?
_list.about_paragraph15_text: Recent, current and future data is presented and compared across data sources.
_list.about_paragraph1_text: d-portal.org helps you explore IATI data by providing a search function and information by country or by publisher on development activities and budgets published to the platform.
_list.about_paragraph2_text: It is aimed at providing line ministries, parliamentarians and civil society in developing countries with information that can assist with the planning and monitoring of development activities.
_list.about_paragraph3_text: d-portal contains current data published to the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI) as well as the most recent year's data available in the OECD DAC Creditor Reporting System.
_list.about_paragraph4_text: The current platform poses two questions:
_list.about_paragraph5_text: In order to answer these questions from a country perspective it is insufficient merely to display available data: it is equally important to show the gaps in the information. Coping with poor quality or missing data is an essential part of the information interface.
_list.about_paragraph6_text: is an open source platform. This means you can use all aspects of the platform to build your own portal using the free source code.
_list.about_paragraph7_text: While it currently provides a generic deployment for any country it has been developed with the specific intention of being customised in-country to meet local needs. For further information on how you could create a customised version for a specific country, see How to Install.
_list.about_paragraph9_text: The initial development of d-portal.org which ran from Dec 2013 to the Global Partnership meeting in Mexico in April 2014 was funded by IATI and Development Initiatives (DI).
_list.alert1_text: d-portal.org is still in beta. Thank you for your patience! Please provide any feedback
_list.beige0: {beige_alert_text} {beige_alert_here_text}.
_list.country_dropmenu_text: Type to search for a Recipient Country
_list.dash_paragraph1_text: Dash is an overview of the data populating d-portal.org with a focus primarily on publisher statistics and the quality of the data reported by them.
_list.dash_paragraph2_text: By showing you when and where invalid data is reported, Dash will be able to explain the gaps that are reflected on the main site.
_list.dash_paragraph3_text: Dash is not country specific so you will be able to view all of the publisher statistics available across all countries included in the portal. This is to accommodate the fact that there are multiple publishers that report activities in multiple recipient countries.
_list.dash_paragraph4_text: Dash is currently accessible at http://d-portal.org/ctrack.html?#view=dash. Dash is still being developed.
_list.discover_paragraph1_text: Discover is a new feature that is currently under second stage of development. Backed by dstore and Q, it provides a simple interface for users to filter through the vast IATI database.
_list.discover_paragraph2_text: We are currently seeking feedback about the intuitiveness and usability of Discover. Do have a go and send us your feedback by adding a new issue through the Github forum or, if you prefer, get in touch through support@iatistandard.org. We'd love to hear what you think!
_list.dstore_paragraph_text: dstore subsidises the IATI Registry with an optimized nodejs + SQLite version for use in real time queries.
_list.explore_paragraph1_text: Pick a country or publisher below to explore their data.
_list.explore_paragraph2_text: Only countries and publishers with data published to IATI are available for exploration.
_list.faq_paragraph1_text: d-portal is an expansive site that contains not only the country and publisher based portals but also tools like SAVi, Generator, Dash and the recently developed Discover - a simple search interface backed by dstore and Q. With this comes a growing database of questions about the architecture and functionality of the different parts of the site.
_list.faq_paragraph2_text: These are broken down into 3 different types of questions - General, Technical and questions about the Generator.
_list.feedback_paragraph1_text: Hello all and thank you for taking part as beta testers for d-portal.org. We welcome any and all feedback, suggestions and concerns you may have about the website so please feel free to post them as comments below. Overall, we want to focus on legibility and user experience, especially in terms of understanding the data that is being presented.
_list.feedback_paragraph2_text: Thank you very much for taking the time to do this! We hope to create something useful and easily deployable, an interesting talking point but most importantly, promote use by those who need the information, and better data quality from reporting organisations.
_list.footer1_text: A 2017 project by the d-portal team
_list.footer8_text: It provides a search function and information by country or by publisher on development activities and budgets published to IATI.
_list.footer9_text: We are currently in BETA. While d-portal is publicly available, it is not considered finished. You may experience bugs and missing features, but that is why we need your feedback and support.
_list.gen_paragraph1_text: There is a huge amount of interesting information within IATI and significant value in being able to share bite-size pieces of it freely on other websites and blogs. The d-portal generator allows users to select specific information from d-portal and embed it directly into their own website code.
_list.gen_paragraph2_text: Once you’ve embedded any content it will update automatically (overnight) as publishers’ data is updated in the IATI registry. When users click on the content they will be directed to the relevant page on d-portal so they can investigate further.
_list.gen_paragraph3_text: The generator is currently accessible at http://www.d-portal.org/ctrack.html?#view=generator.
_list.github_info2_text: d-portal.org is open source. It is currently being developed and designed so things are constantly changing. Do send us your suggestions, code contributions, bug reports, fixes and issues or contact support@iatistandard.org
_list.github_info3_text: If you would like to keep up to date with news on d-portal please subscribe to the Google group.

</select>

<script>

			}
		});

</script>

about_paragraph10_text: DI finance le stade actuel de développement et de préparation à la fin de Août 2014, si vous êtes intéressé par une partie du financement de l'élaboration en cours de d- portail s'il vous plaît contacter support@iatistandard.org
about_paragraph11_text: Le concept open source repose sur le partage des ressources dans l'espoir que d'autres se joindront et construire une meilleure plate-forme ensemble. Cela comprend la recherche et signaler les bogues, contribuant de nouvelles fonctionnalités que vous souhaitez la plate-forme d'avoir ou même de créer de nouveaux thèmes afin que les autres puissent l'utiliser.
about_paragraph12_text: Autres sites basés sur d-portal seront listés ci-dessous. Contactez-nous au support@iatistandard.org d'ajouter le vôtre ici.
about_paragraph14_text: 1. D'où proviennent les ressources? 2. Où vont-ils (par secteur et localisation)?
about_paragraph15_text: Des données récentes, actuelles et futures est présenté et comparé les sources de données.
about_paragraph1_text: d-portal.org vous aide à explorer les données IATI en fournissant des informations par pays ou par l'éditeur sur les activités de développement et les budgets publiés à IATI.
about_paragraph2_text: Il vise à fournir des ministères de tutelle , les parlementaires et la société civile des informations qui peuvent aider à la planification et au suivi des activités de développement.
about_paragraph3_text: Dans sa première itération , il contient des données actuelles publiées par l'Initiative internationale pour la transparence de l'aide ( IATI ), ainsi que les plus récentes (2012) données publiées par la créanciers du CAD de l'OCDE système de notification .
about_paragraph4_text: La plate-forme actuelle pose deux questions : d'où viennent les ressources proviennent , et où vont-ils ( par secteur et localisation) ? Des données récentes , en cours et à venir est présenté et comparé différentes sources de données.
about_paragraph5_text: Afin de répondre à ces questions dans une perspective de pays, il ne suffit pas simplement d'afficher des données disponibles :
about_paragraph6_text: est une plate-forme open source. Cela signifie que vous pouvez utiliser tous les aspects de la plate-forme pour construire votre propre portail en utilisant le code source libre.
about_paragraph7_text: Bien qu'il fournit actuellement un déploiement générique pour n'importe quel pays, il a été développé avec l'intention spécifique d'être personnalisée dans le pays pour répondre aux besoins locaux. Pour plus d'informations sur la façon dont vous pouvez créer une version personnalisée pour un pays spécifique, voir Comment installer .
about_paragraph9_text: Le développement initial de d - portal.org qui a duré à partir de décembre 2013 pour la réunion du Partenariat mondial au Mexique en Avril 2014 a été financée par IATI et Development Initiatives (DI).
alert1_text: d-portal.org est encore en développement très tôt, prévue pour Alpha presse mi-Avril. Merci pour votre patience! S'il vous plaît fournir une rétroaction
beige0: {beige_alert_text} {beige_alert_here_text}.
dash_paragraph1_text: Dash est un aperçu des données qui peuplent d-portal.org avec un accent principalement sur ​​les statistiques de l'éditeur et la qualité des données déclarées par eux.
dash_paragraph2_text: En vous montrant où et quand des données non valides est rapporté, Dash sera en mesure d'expliquer les écarts qui se reflètent sur ​​le site principal.
dash_paragraph3_text: Dash n'est pas pays spécifique de sorte que vous pourrez voir toutes les statistiques des éditeurs disponibles dans tous les pays inclus dans le portail. C'est à accueillir le fait qu'il existe plusieurs éditeurs qui signalent des activités dans plusieurs pays bénéficiaires.
dash_paragraph4_text: Dash est actuellement accessible à l'adresse http://d-portal.org/ctrack.html?#view=dash. Dash est une nouvelle fonctionnalité et est encore en cours d'élaboration.
discover_paragraph1_text: Discover est une nouvelle fonctionnalité qui est actuellement en cours de développement. Soutenu par dStore et Q, il fournira une interface de recherche simple pour les utilisateurs de filtrer à travers la vaste base de données de IATI.
discover_paragraph2_text: Nous recherchons actuellement des commentaires sur le intuitivité et la convivialité de Discover. N'avoir un aller et envoyez-nous vos commentaires en ajoutant une nouvelle émission à travers le Github forum ou, si vous préférez, entrer en contact par le biais support@iatistandard.org . Nous aimerions entendre ce que vous pensez!
dstore_paragraph_text: dstore subventionne l' IATI Registry avec une version nodejs + SQLite optimisé pour une utilisation dans les requêtes en temps réel.
explore_paragraph1_text: Choisissez un pays ou de l'éditeur ci-dessous pour explorer leurs données.
explore_paragraph2_text: Seuls les pays et les éditeurs avec les données publiées à IATI sont disponibles pour l'exploration.
faq_paragraph1_text: d-portail est un site expansive qui contient des portails basés non seulement du pays et de l'éditeur, mais aussi des outils comme Savi, Générateur, Dash et bientôt, Recherche - une interface de recherche simple soutenue par dStore et Q. Avec cela vient d'une base de données de plus en plus de questions sur l'architecture et le fonctionnement des différentes parties du site.
faq_paragraph2_text: Pour l'instant, nous brisons ces bas à 3 différents types de questions - général, technique et des questions sur le générateur. À l'avenir, nous allons ajouter plusieurs onglets à la liste pour compenser les fonctionnalités à venir.
faq_paragraph3_text: FAQ peut être trouvé à l'adresse http://www.d-portal.org/faq.html .
feedback_paragraph1_text: Bonjour, tous et vous remercier d'avoir pris part en tant que bêta-testeurs pour d-portal.org. Nous accueillons toutes et tous commentaires, suggestions et préoccupations que vous pourriez avoir sur le site donc s'il vous plaît n'hésitez pas à les poster dans les commentaires ci-dessous. Globalement, nous voulons nous concentrer sur la lisibilité et de l'expérience de l'utilisateur, notamment en termes de compréhension des données qui vous est présentée.
feedback_paragraph2_text: Merci beaucoup d'avoir pris le temps de le faire! Nous espérons créer quelque chose d'utile et facile à déployer, un sujet de discussion intéressant, mais le plus important, de promouvoir une meilleure qualité de données d'organisations de rapports.
footer15_text: Generator - Widgets pour votre site web
footer1_text: Un projet 2014 par l'équipe du d-portal
footer1_tip_text: Initiative internationale pour la transparence de l'aide (IATI)
footer7_text: vous aide à explorer les données de IATI.
footer8_text: Il fournit des informations par pays ou par l'éditeur sur les activités de développement et les budgets publiés à IATI.
footer9_text: Nous sommes actuellement en BETA. Alors que d-portail est accessible au public, il est pas considéré comme terminé. Vous pouvez rencontrer des bugs et fonctionnalités manquantes, mais qui est la raison pour laquelle nous avons besoin de vos commentaires et de soutien.
gen_paragraph1_text: Il y a une énorme quantité d'informations intéressantes au sein de l'IATI et la valeur significative de pouvoir partager bouchées de librement sur d'autres sites et blogs. Le générateur d-portail permet aux utilisateurs de sélectionner des informations spécifiques à partir d-portail et intégrer directement dans leur propre code de site.
gen_paragraph2_text: Une fois que vous avez intégré tout contenu qu'il mettra automatiquement à jour (la nuit) que les données des éditeurs est mis à jour dans le registre de IATI. Lorsque les utilisateurs cliquent sur le contenu, ils seront dirigés vers la page correspondante sur le d-portail afin qu'ils puissent étudier plus.
gen_title_text: Generator - Widgets pour votre site web
github_info2_text: d-portal.org est actuellement développé et conçu dans les choses changent constamment. Envoyez-nous vos suggestions, rapports et questions bug ou contactez support@iatistandard.org
github_info3_text: Si vous souhaitez rester à jour avec des nouvelles sur d-portal s'il vous plaît vous abonner au groupe de Google.
head:
<title>{title}</title>
<style>
{css}
</style>
index_paragraph1_text: est une plate-forme d'information sur le pays qui permet de suivre les flux de ressources. Elle vise à fournir des ministères de tutelle, les parlementaires et la société civile des informations qui peuvent aider à la planification et au suivi des activités de développement.
index_paragraph2_text: Dans sa première itération, il contient des données actuelles publiées par l'Initiative internationale pour la transparence de l'aide (IATI), ainsi que les plus récentes (2012) des données agrégées publiées par le créancier CAD de l'OCDE Système de notification. Développement futur comprendra, entre autres, les données des information sur l'aide systèmes de gestion, les budgets nationaux et une série d'indicateurs socio- économiques comparables.
index_paragraph3_text: Les données dans le menu déroulant est construit à partir de la base de données qui met à jour tous les jours GMT +0 avec de nouvelles données récupérées à partir du Registre de IATI.
index_paragraph4_text: Nous listons les pays qui sont signalés par les éditeurs utilisant ISO3166 Alpha-2. Pour l'attribution et un lien vers les sources de données, aller ici.
index_paragraph5_text: La liste des éditeurs avec leur IATI éditeur ID vient directement de la base de données du Registre de IATI.
index_paragraph6_text: La liste déroulante des éditeurs provient des activités XML publiés rapportés par ces éditeurs.
index_title2_text: Où sont les données à partir de?
install_info_text: Créer des widgets pour votre site web.
install_paragraph1_text: Au cœur du projet d-portal est le but que n'importe qui n'importe où peut prendre le code open source derrière d-portail, déployer pour eux-mêmes et de créer un portail d-mesure pour un pays qui les intéresse. Cela pourrait inclure l'ajout d'autres données de l'aide des systèmes d'information de gestion, les budgets nationaux et une série d'indicateurs socio-économiques comparables.
install_paragraph2_text: Il existe déjà des exemples de mesure d-portals par pays comme suit:
install_paragraph3_text: d-portal est constitué de la backend dstore et l'interface ctrack. Pour installer d-portal, vous devez configurer un serveur.
install_paragraph4_text: Commencez à lire des instructions pour installer un serveur d-portal
install_paragraph5_text: En utilisant les iframes, le générateur d-portalvous permet d'intégrer des sections de d-portaldans une plate-forme d'édition html activé; ie. Wordpress blog, après Tumblr, un site Web, etc
install_paragraph6_text: Visitez http://d-portal.org/ctrack.html#view=generator de créer un widget d-portal.

news_link2_text: How to create a country d-portal
news_paragraph1_text: Cette page contient toutes les mises à jour de l'information et les caractéristiques actuelles sur d-portail au cours du développement.
news_paragraph2_text: Si vous voulez tenir à jour avec des nouvelles sur d-portail à travers une liste de diffusion, nous recommandons rejoindre le groupe Google. Cette option permet la livraison de d-portail des annonces directement dans votre boîte e-mail.
news_paragraph3_text: Les mises à jour sont peu fréquentes.
news_paragraph4_text: Commencez à lire Nouvelles http://www.d-portal.org/news.html .
publisher_paragraph1_text: Choisissez un éditeur ci-dessous pour explorer leurs données.
q_example1_info1_text: Cette requête affiche activités de limiter le montant à 10
q_example1_text: Retourne XML qui est automatiquement formaté en HTML (SAVi). Source reste pur XML
q_example2_info1_text: Cette requête affiche toutes les activités de Bangladesh (code du pays est BD)
q_example2_info2_text: qui ont secteurs signalés dans les données
q_example2_info3_text: En fin de compte, cette requête vous permet de regarder toutes les activités qui ont des graphiques en eux.
q_example3_info1_text: Cette requête affiche des statistiques de données
q_example3_info2_text: sur activites pour chaque organisation de rapports
q_example3_text: Retourne JSON (JSON est par défaut) des données sur les activites (activités sont par défaut) où 100 lignes de la base de données est la limite par défaut
q_example4_info1_text: Cette requête vous permet de télécharger le CSV
q_example4_text: Retours fichier CSV (nommé q.csv par défaut)
q_example_append1_text: Append requêtes avec votre format préféré
q_example_savi_text: Retourne XML qui est automatiquement formaté en HTML (SAVi). Source reste pur XML
q_paragraph_text: Q vous permet d'interroger les informations dont vous avez besoin via des filtres simples mais complexes.
savi_paragraph1_text: Savi est une visionneuse d'activité simple pour l'IATI XML que vous pouvez voir en temps réel, en ligne, dans votre navigateur préféré.
savi_paragraph2_text: Savi utilise CSS et javascript pour afficher XML autrement complexe regardant dans un format qui est plus facile à lire et à digérer.

tongue_select:
<form action="">
<select id="tongue_select" name="tongue">
	{tongue_select_options:tongue_select_option}
</select>
</form>

<script>
	$(function(){
		$('#tongue_select').children().each(function(i,it){
			if("{tongue}"==$(it).val())
			{
				$(it).attr("selected",1)
			}
		});
		$('#tongue_select').bind('change', function ()
		{
			var t="{_root}"+$(this).val()+"/";if(t=="{_root}eng/"){t="{_root}";}
			var url = t+"{_output_filename}";
			window.location = url; // redirect
			return false;
		});
	});
</script>
